Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.quota

Class QuotaPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.quota.QuotaPolicy
  • public class QuotaPolicy
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines quota limits for a role or as a default policy.

    A quota policy specifies the storage and message limits that apply to users who are members of a particular role, or as the system default.

    Size Parsing

    The parseSize(String) method accepts human-readable sizes:

    • "100MB" - 100 megabytes
    • "10GB" - 10 gigabytes
    • "1TB" - 1 terabyte
    • "unlimited" or "-1" - no limit
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    QuotaManager

                   long storageLimit,

        Creates a quota policy with the specified limits.
        Parameters:
        name - the policy name (typically a role name)
        storageLimit - storage limit in bytes, or -1 for unlimited
        messageLimit - message count limit, or -1 for unlimited

      • parseSize

        public static long parseSize​(java.lang.String sizeStr)
        Parses a human-readable size string into bytes.

        Supported formats:

        • Plain number: "1234567890" (bytes)
        • Kilobytes: "100KB" or "100K"
        • Megabytes: "100MB" or "100M"
        • Gigabytes: "10GB" or "10G"
        • Terabytes: "1TB" or "1T"
        • Unlimited: "unlimited" or "-1"
        Parameters:
        sizeStr - the size string to parse
        Returns:
        size in bytes, or -1 for unlimited
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the format is invalid

      • formatSize

        public static java.lang.String formatSize​(long bytes)
        Formats a byte size as a human-readable string.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the size in bytes
        Returns:
        formatted string (e.g., "1.5 GB")
